00210 
00211         bool  ReadParameter  ( pstr S, realtype & X, // reads parameter
00212                                int ParColumn=40 );   // name S and val X
00213         bool  ReadParameter  ( pstr S, int & X,
00214                                int ParColumn=40 );
00215 
00216         bool  ReadParameters ( pstr S, int & n_X,  // reads parameter
00217                                rvector X,          // name S, counts the
00218                                int MaxLen=255,     // of values n_X and
00219                                int ParColumn=40 ); // reads X[0..n_X-1].
00220                                                   // MaxLen gives sizeof(S)
00221 
00222         //   WriteColumns writes data stored in X, Y and Z in the form
00223         // of columns, adding a blank line in the end. If Z (or Z and Y)
00224         // are set to NULL, then only X and Y (or only X) are written.
00225         //   Shift corresponds to the begining of arrays' enumeration
00226         // X[Shift..Shift+len-1].
00227         bool  WriteColumns ( rvector X, rvector Y, rvector Z,
00228                              int len, int Shift, int MLength );
00229         bool  WriteColumns ( rvector X, rvector Y,
00230                              int len, int Shift, int MLength );
00231 
00232         //   ReadColumns reads data stored by WriteColumns. X, Y, and Z
00233         // must be allocated prior to call.
00234         //   xCol, yCol and zCol specify the order number of columns
00235         // (starting from 0) to be read into X, Y and Z, correspondingly.
00236         // If zCol (or zCol and yCol) < 0 then Z (or Z and Y) are not read.
00237         //   Shift corresponds to the begining of arrays' enumeration
00238         // X[Shift..Shift+len-1].
00239         //   Returns number of lines read.
00240         int   ReadColumns  ( int maxlen, rvector X, rvector Y, rvector Z,
00241                              int xCol, int yCol, int zCol, int Shift );
00242         int   ReadColumns  ( int maxlen, rvector X, rvector Y,
00243                              int xCol, int yCol, int Shift );
00244 
00245         //   CreateReadColumns reads data stored by WriteColumns. X, Y,
00246         // and Z must be set to NULL prior to call. They will be allocated
00247         // within the procedure.
00248         //   xCol, yCol and zCol specify the order number of columns
00249         // (starting from 0) to be read into X, Y and Z, correspondingly.
00250         // If zCol (or zCol and yCol) < 0 then Z (or Z and Y) are not read.
00251         //   Shift corresponds to the begining of arrays' enumeration
00252         // X[Shift..Shift+len-1].
00253         //   Returns number of lines read, errors are reported by
00254         // ErrorCode().
00255         int  CreateReadColumns ( rvector & X, rvector & Y, rvector & Z,
00256                                  int xCol, int yCol, int zCol, int Shift );
00257         int  CreateReadColumns ( rvector & X, rvector & Y,
00258                                  int xCol, int yCol, int Shift );
00259 
00260         // ---- miscellaneous
00261         realtype GetNumber ( cpstr S );
00262         FILE *   GetHandle () { return hFile; }
00263 
00264       protected :
00265         word    Buf_Size;
00266         bool    TextMode,UniBin;

00269         word    BufCnt,BufLen,BufInc;

00274         bool    IOSuccess;

00276

00280                              int xCol, int yCol, int zCol, int Shift );
00281 
00282       private :

00284         bool  StdIO,memIO;
00285 
00286     };
